title: Understanding Table Joins
text: In SQL, joining tables is a way to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.

title: Why Join Multiple Tables?
text: Sometimes, the data you need is spread across multiple tables. Joining them allows you to retrieve all necessary information in a single query.

hintAnswer: The necessary information is not available in fewer tables.
title: Reason for Joining Three or More Tables
text: Consider a scenario where you have a database with tables for customers, orders, and products. To find out which products a customer has ordered, you might need to join all three tables.
choices: The necessary information is not available in fewer tables.
There are too many tables in your database.
You need to create a central repository.
You need to reduce storage requirements.
